Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
River levels have peaked on the river mole yesterday evening and are now falling steadily. The risk of flooding has now passed. 
The forecast is for dry weather for the next 3 days. 
We are monitoring the situation and will issue further Alerts and Warnings when necessary.

Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Stour, River Lodden, River Shreen

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Hundred Foot Washes in Cambridgeshire and Norfolk

floodArea.riverOrSea: Old Bedford River, New Bedford River, Hundred Foot Drain, River Delph

items.message: River levels are rising on the Hundred Foot Washes as a result of recent rainfall and floodwater moving down the River Great Ouse and into the Hundred Foot Washes.  Flooding is affecting Hundred Foot Washes, also known as the Ouse Washes, including the causeways of Welney and Sutton Gault.  We will liaise with the relevant highways authorities as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  No further rainfall is forecast for the next few days.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from rivers.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast and remain aware of your local situation.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  No further rainfall is forecast.  We continue to monitor the situation.

items.message:
Flooding is expected in this area. This means properties are at risk of flooding.

Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. Consider activating any property flood protection products you may have.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.description: The upper Stour and surrounding tributaries
The River Colne from Great Yeldham to Colchester

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: River Stort and Stansted Brook catchment
items.message:
River levels have fallen overnight as rainfall eases.
No property flooding is expected.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

River levels have fallen throughout today, Sunday 2nd April as rainfall has eased.
No property flooding is expected.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  No further rainfall is forecast for the next few days.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from rivers.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast and remain aware of your local situation.
